S.FORM: Miqumisang, haip qanian na isnavak amu tu tuqauq a itu Bunun kakaunun tu qalinga.
Miqomisang, haip qanian na isnavak amo to toqaoq a ito Bonon kakaonon to qalinga.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的布農語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today, I am going to teach you how to say the Bunun language for food.
Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: Masnanava! nii ak itqaal, Maqtu muqnang bazbaz?
Masnanava! nii ak itqaal, Maqto moqnang bazbaz?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: Nii ak utan-aan, Maqtu pidaingun qalinga tu tikis?
Nii ak otan-aan, Maqto pidaingon qalinga to tikis?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: Sadua aas dii! Kinkinuza aas zaku masipul.
Sadoa aas dii! Kinkinoza aas zako masipol.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.
Read it again. Please speak louder.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: Simula aas dingalan uskunan mapasnava tun isqaqaisqais.
Simola aas dingalan oskonan mapasnava ton isqaqaisqais.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: Na pan-iti in ata mapasnava na ihan muqnin lihai muqna mapasadu.
Na pan-iti in ata mapasnava na ihan moqnin lihai moqna mapasado.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: Isia aak Vilian uvaz-az, Tupaun ngan tu Sipal.
Isia aak Vilian ovaz-az, Topaon ngan to Sipal.
S.TRANSL: I am Vilian's son and my name is Sipal.

S.FORM: Isia aak Vilian ta isnanavan tupaun ngan tu Sipal.
Isia aak Vilian ta isnanavan topaon ngan to Sipal.
S.TRANSL: I am a student of Vilian and my name is Sipal.

S.FORM: Tupaun inak Tama ngan tu Vilian.
Topaon inak Tama ngan to Vilian.
Inak aipun masituqas nanaz. Tupaun ngan tu Tulbus.
Inak aipon masitoqas nanaz. Topaon ngan to Tolbos.
S.TRANSL: He is my brother, his name is Kolas. *[Kolas] please change the names to men of all races.

S.FORM: Inak aipun kaviaz, Tupaun istun ngan tu Sani.
Inak aipon kaviaz, Topaon iston ngan to Sani.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Sani。
She is my friend and her name is Sani.

S.FORM: Piaqin sia Tama suu haip punsanan qamisan.
Piaqin sia Tama soo haip ponsanan qamisan.
Inak Tama mahimanin qamisan haip tu punsanan.
Inak Tama mahimanin qamisan haip to ponsanan.

S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: Haiza nak dusa masituqas, Tas-a masinauba.
Haiza nak dosa masitoqas, Tas-a masinaoba.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.
How many people are in your family?

S.FORM: Haiza nam papat tastu lumaq Bunun.
Haiza nam papat tasto lomaq Bonon.
S.TRANSL: There are four of us in our family.
I studied in [Hualien]. *Hualien] is free to change places.

S.FORM: Isu tu pantamaun maaq ista kuzkuzaun?
Iso to pantamaon maaq ista kozkozaon?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: Isu tu masituqas nauaz haiza ista kuzkuzaun?
Iso to masitoqas naoaz haiza ista kozkozaon?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?
他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?
Yes, but she is a Amis.
Yes, we are all very tall.
Does your sister go to school?
Do your siblings speak the language?
Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.
你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: Uu, muskun aak inak Tama Tina.
Uo, moskon aak inak Tama Tina.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: Muskun aas isu tu Aki Bai?
Moskon aas iso to Aki Bai?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?
不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: Muskun aak inak Tama, Tina, Masituqas nanaz.
Moskon aak inak Tama, Tina, Masitoqas nanaz.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.
你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: Maqi pal-unin aak ka musuqis tupa aak.
Maqi pal-onin aak ka mosoqis topa aak.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.

S.FORM: Ma aak ka Bunun tu uvaz-az.
Ma aak ka Bonon to ovaz-az.

S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: Nii haip tu mabaqis nii amin makazhav, Masihal saa.
Nii haip to mabaqis nii amin makazhav, Masihal saa.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: Uka luhum ihan diqanin, Santasal in a bintuqan.
Uka lohom ihan diqanin, Santasal in a bintoqan.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: Isdangza in, Sansuma in vali, Munhapav in qanivalval.
Isdangza in, Sansoma in vali, Monhapav in qanivalval.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
What's the weather like where you are?
We're going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

S.FORM: Makazhav a diqanin, Asa pidai-un hulus mainuk.
Makazhav a diqanin, Asa pidai-on holos mainok.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: Na su'zaq unisin, Asa nitu sipungul madas talulung.
Na so'zaq onisin, Asa nito sipongol madas talolong.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: Bitvaqan sa-ngan. Na qudanan unisin maa.
Bitvaqan sa-ngan. Na qodanan onisin maa.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.
好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: Qudanan? Mavia as luvus a hubung?
Qodanan? Mavia as lovos a hobong?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: Qudanan a nata, Nii ak madas i talulung.
Qodanan a nata, Nii ak madas i talolong.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: Madaing a luvluv, Masakbit a bungu kaliluvluv un.
Madaing a lovlov, Masakbit a bongo kalilovlov on.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: Madaing a vali, Qalipasav a bungu asvali un.
Madaing a vali, Qalipasav a bongo asvali on.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: Nii aak amin madas, Mabaliv ata.
Nii aak amin madas, Mabaliv ata.
S.TRANSL: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?
Well, I still have to buy erasers.
Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

S.FORM: Nii aak, Minaun in aak han lumaq.
Nii aak, Minaon in aak han lomaq.
S.TRANSL: No, I've already eaten at home.
I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.
那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let's eat my lunch box together!
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: Na maun aak isia kaku pisihal hubung tu paitutaungqu.
Na maon aak isia kako pisihal hobong to paitotaongqo.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: Haiza nak haip dasun timuqus, Muskun ata taungqu in maun.
Haiza nak haip dason timoqos, Moskon ata taongqo in maon.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!
Let's go play basketball, shall we?
Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: Uu, Aivak aas dii asik un.
Uo, Aivak aas dii asik on.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll give you this broom.
Can you get me a rag, please?

S.FORM: Ma'asik aak lapadau, Tupa i su Taliban tu dangaz i aas siza.
Ma'asik aak lapadao, Topa i so Taliban to dangaz i aas siza.
S.TRANSL: I'm sweeping the floor and you asked Taliban to help you.
The table is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I'll go get the cloth.

S.FORM: Vanas a mataqdung saa, Iping maqaisqais.
Vanas a mataqdong saa, Iping maqaisqais.
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: Unisin, Niang nak iti tu-nganun ma'asik.
Unisin, Niang nak iti to-nganon ma'asik.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: Maqi pudan in un in han Kaku malka maaq aas?
Maqi podan in on in han Kako malka maaq aas?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: Na muskun aak inak kaviaz tusasaus.
Na moskon aak inak kaviaz tosasaos.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: Na malka maaq aas pudanun in han kaku.
Na malka maaq aas podanon in han kako.

S.TRANSL: May I ask if Mai-ia is home?
She’s at home, please come in.
May I ask if Ibu is home?

S.FORM: Uka aipa, Maaq su na iskilim?
Uka aipa, Maaq so na iskilim?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?
Grandpa, I’m Savi, please open the door.

S.FORM: Ulih, Mua' aak, Kilim aak su'u na pisqaitmal.
Ulih, Moa' aak, Kilim aak so'o na pisqaitmal.
S.TRANSL: Ulih, I’m Mua’, I’ve come to play with you.

S.FORM: Tuza! Minliskin aak su'u. Kava minsuma pababazbaz ata.
Toza! Minliskin aak so'o. Kava minsoma pababazbaz ata.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: Azuq! Ma ququt-aqun dii a saqalan tu masihal.
Azoq! Ma qoqot-aqon dii a saqalan to masihal.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。
媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: Tamasaza maun, Nii aas tu nata Bunun.
Tamasaza maon, Nii aas to nata Bonon.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.
I ate a lot, I’m full.

S.FORM: Na mudanin aak. Muqnin muqna mapasadu su'u.
Na modanin aak. Moqnin moqna mapasado so'o.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

S.FORM: Maqmut in. Na mudanin aak lumaq.
Maqmot in. Na modanin aak lomaq.
Uu, Haiza ail-uan munhan lumaq nak qaitmal.
Uo, Haiza ail-oan monhan lomaq nak qaitmal.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: Miqumisang, Maaq haip sinsi a na madas ita tantungu han asang tu madadaingaz na mapabazbaz.
Miqomisang, Maaq haip sinsi a na madas ita tantongo han asang to madadaingaz na mapabazbaz.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: Masihal! Namuskun ata madadainga malasBunun mapabazbaz.
Masihal! Namoskon ata madadainga malasBonon mapabazbaz.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說布農語。
Okay! We’re going to speak Bunun to the seniors.
Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.
你們會說布農語啊!真是太棒了!

S.FORM: Miqumisang, Dasun zaku amu haip munhan quma malkamaduq.
Miqomisang, Dason zako amo haip monhan qoma malkamadoq.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: Zain amu kana sia dailav, Nii sipungul madas iskuzakuza tu qaimangsut.
Zain amo kana sia dailav, Nii sipongol madas iskozakoza to qaimangsot.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: Uu, Sinsi, Amin in aam siza i na iskuzakuza tu qaimangsut.
Uo, Sinsi, Amin in aam siza i na iskozakoza to qaimangsot.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: Miqumisang, Na munhan ata haip isqaqailangan si-ni-na-naipuk tu dadangi-an.
Miqomisang, Na monhan ata haip isqaqailangan si-ni-na-naipok to dadangi-an.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.
好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: Asa ata sana dailaz maldangkaz, Na mal-iumpi in ata mabaliv kipu.
Asa ata sana dailaz maldangkaz, Na mal-iompi in ata mabaliv kipo.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: Ma ngaus a luqi tanhiku a ivut, Anaka amu sadu.
Ma ngaos a loqi tanhiko a ivot, Anaka amo sado.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.
It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: Maaq ata ki tasban in tas-a tukii a musuqis mu-anpuk.
Maaq ata ki tasban in tas-a tokii a mosoqis mo-anpok.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: Sadu aak madiadaingaz tu ivut, Haizang madia tu luqi.
Sado aak madiadaingaz to ivot, Haizang madia to loqi.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: Mantala'a zaku, Ma saingu nak bantas.
Mantala'a zako, Ma saingo nak bantas.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.
There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: Makumbu ita danum, I-iti ata lingqaul na masial.
Makombo ita danom, I-iti ata lingqaol na masial.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?

S.FORM: Tama nak ma-unting Laihlaih mama' zaku.
Tama nak ma-onting Laihlaih mama' zako.

S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: Maquaq suu Bai a mabaliv sanglav?
Maqoaq soo Bai a mabaliv sanglav?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?
She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: Na tundaza aak qatu munhan Pangkalkalan.
Na tondaza aak qato monhan Pangkalkalan.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: Na tun-daza aipa Hikuki' munhan Pangkalkalan.
Na ton-daza aipa Hikoki' monhan Pangkalkalan.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.
What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?
He took a train to Kaohsiung.
Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: Uu, Tundaza aipa Laihlaih munhan Tai-tu.
Uo, Tondaza aipa Laihlaih monhan Tai-to.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.
Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: Nii, Tundaza aipa Hikuki munhan Tai-tu.
Nii, Tondaza aipa Hikoki monhan Tai-to.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.
Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: Haiza, Munhan ngaus a na usaduan in aas papanduan Vasu.
Haiza, Monhan ngaos a na osadoan in aas papandoan Vaso.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: paka iti isaq a mishuan i papanduan Laihlaih?
paka iti isaq a mishoan i papandoan Laihlaih?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的車站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest station to here?

S.FORM: Uka iti papanduan Laihlaih, Lusqa maqtu tun Hai-ia.
Uka iti papandoan Laihlaih, Losqa maqto ton Hai-ia.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有車站，你只能坐計程車
There is no station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: Pan laquaq a Vasu pansan Kaku?
Pan laqoaq a Vaso pansan Kako?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: Piaq tinun dazan tukii pasan Taiciu?
Piaq tinon dazan tokii pasan Taicio?
S.TRANSL: 搭要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung?
I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: Unting laihlaih pasan U-lai ka talmadia?
Unting laihlaih pasan U-lai ka talmadia?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: Tundaza aas Vasu munhan lumaq nak na talmadia?
Tondaza aas Vaso monhan lomaq nak na talmadia?
S.TRANSL: 你搭公車來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to take the bus to my house?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?
Don't, I don't know much about it.

S.FORM: Haiza suu tinaungqu ail-uan? Na asa aak mun su-uan tantungu maqtu aas?
Haiza soo tinaongqo ail-oan? Na asa aak mon so-oan tantongo maqto aas?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎
Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: Azuq, Na ihan aak inak lumaq mantatala. su'u.
Azoq, Na ihan aak inak lomaq mantatala. so'o.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: Haiza suu laqbingin ail-uan? Na asa aak mapabazbaz suu pali'uni itu Bunun minpakaliva ituqabasan tu liniqaiban.
Haiza soo laqbingin ail-oan? Na asa aak mapabazbaz soo pali'oni ito Bonon minpakaliva itoqabasan to liniqaiban.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於布農族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I would like to ask you about the legendary story of the Bunun tribe.

S.FORM: Laqbingin a na muhan aak ba'av, Na uka aak han lumaq.
Laqbingin a na mohan aak ba'av, Na oka aak han lomaq.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

S.FORM: Tinan-ah aak tu madau aas a pali-uni itu Bunun iniqumisan tu dailaz maqansiapdaingaz Na asa mapasnava suu.
Tinan-ah aak to madao aas a pali-oni ito Bonon iniqomisan to dailaz maqansiapdaingaz Na asa mapasnava soo.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對布農族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you know a lot about Bunun traditional customs and would like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: Nii nak madia qansaipun, Qaal na mintamasaz aak antalam suu.
Nii nak madia qansaipon, Qaal na mintamasaz aak antalam soo.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: Maqtu aak siqaningu su'u? Maqi huata tauna haiphaipin ti na mahaipi upatasan.
Maqto aak siqaningo so'o? Maqi hoata taona haiphaipin ti na mahaipi opatasan.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: Tupa suu tu piaq in suu qamisan?
Topa soo to piaq in soo qamisan?
Masivaun qan vau in nak qamisan.
Masivaon qan vao in nak qamisan.
Tupa suu tu maina isaq aas?
Topa soo to maina isaq aas?
Maina han aak Bahuan asang minsuma.
Maina han aak Bahoan asang minsoma.
S.TRANSL: I come from the Mayon tribe.

S.FORM: Tupa suu tu Bunun suu pakatuszangan?
Topa soo to Bonon soo pakatoszangan?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是布農族人嗎?
Is your wife also a Bunun?

S.FORM: Haip qanian manaskal mapabazbaz suu, Tanama taqu, Ma pali-uni qanup tu samuh maqtu?
Haip qanian manaskal mapabazbaz soo, Tanama taqo, Ma pali-oni qanop to samoh maqto?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: Uu ki! Ma talmaindu ang aak a qanglas mun han ba'av qanup.
Uo ki! Ma talmaindo ang aak a qanglas mon han ba'av qanop.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: Uninang! Ma haip sinpasnava suu mananu tu masihaldaingaz.
Uninang! Ma haip sinpasnava soo manano to masihaldaingaz.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: Ma nak sintaqu mamantukdaingaz, Isia maimadadaingaz sinpala' tu sintaqu.
Ma nak sintaqo mamantokdaingaz, Isia maimadadaingaz sinpala' to sintaqo.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: Haip tu sinpabazbaz na pan-iti in. Uninang tutuza isu tu sinngunu tu sipaibazbaz.
Haip to sinpabazbaz na pan-iti in. Uninang totoza iso to sinngono to sipaibazbaz.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: Nitu kua, Na muqna ata mapabazbaz.
Nito koa, Na moqna ata mapabazbaz.
Na mudanin aak. Mantalah muqnin tan-a madadaingaz tu liniqaiban tu sintaquh.
Na modanin aak. Mantalah moqnin tan-a madadaingaz to liniqaiban to sintaqoh.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.
Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a cup.
Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: Na mabaliv aak Kupu, Haiza muu babalivun?
Na mabaliv aak Kopo, Haiza moo babalivon?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?
No, we don't sell betel nut.

S.FORM: Na piaq suu qalup tilas balivun?
Na piaq soo qalop tilas balivon?
S.TRANSL: How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

S.FORM: Na mabaliv aak dusa paan Avula.
Na mabaliv aak dosa paan Avola.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

S.FORM: Musqa in nam midutda tas-a paan.
Mosqa in nam midotda tas-a paan.
S.TRANSL: We only have one bottle left.
How many catties do you want to buy?

S.FORM: Piaq suu tingting na balivun Nibuh?
Piaq soo tingting na balivon Niboh?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: Na mabaliv aak dusa linuqus Saluh.
Na mabaliv aak dosa linoqos Saloh.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: Haizang dii minutda tau linuqus, Amini paisuu.
Haizang dii minotda tao linoqos, Amini paisoo.
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!

S.FORM: Tasqalup dii ka tilas piaq sui?
Tasqalop dii ka tilas piaq soi?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: Muskun mapusa qan tas-a sui, Sipulun a lusqa'un mapusan sui.
Moskon maposa qan tas-a soi, Sipolon a losqa'on maposan soi.
Haiza dii masivaun qan hima sui.
Haiza dii masivaon qan hima soi.
Na muqna aak mabaliv tu tikis, Susan puskunun min tas-a sabah.
Na moqna aak mabaliv to tikis, Sosan poskonon min tas-a sabah.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: Muskunun himasaba tu mas-an a sui.
Moskonon himasaba to mas-an a soi.
Sipulun inak sui azuq hima saba?
Sipolon inak soi azoq hima saba?
Maqlis aipi saa, Maqtu vanaqan masipul tu tikis?
Maqlis aipi saa, Maqto vanaqan masipol to tikis?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

S.FORM: Nii tu maqtu, Nii in aipi tu maqlis.
Nii to maqto, Nii in aipi to maqlis.
S.TRANSL: 不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.

S.FORM: Na mabaliv aak hindii hima qalup tu satuu'
Na mabaliv aak hindii hima qalop to satoo'
S.TRANSL: I want this packet of candy.

S.FORM: Hindii satuu' matiun sui, Duu na haizang duma na sizaun?
Hindii satoo' mation soi, Doo na haizang doma na sizaon?
S.TRANSL: 這糖30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for this candy, need anything else?
Can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: Maqtu! Piaq suu na simulun sui?
Maqto! Piaq soo na simolon soi?
Sipungul aak madas sui, Maqtu aak simul isu sui?
Sipongol aak madas soi, Maqto aak simol iso soi?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: Uka nak amin dasun sui tu!
Uka nak amin dason soi to!
S.TRANSL: I don't have any money either!

S.FORM: Panpungul aak madas sui, Maqtu aak simul su-uan sui?
Panpongol aak madas soi, Maqto aak simol so-oan soi?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: Nii aii! Sinimul aas tudip nii ang aas maisuqis.
Nii aii! Sinimol aas todip nii ang aas maisoqis.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: Pasimul ing aak isu Tauntaun maqtu?
Pasimol ing aak iso Taontaon maqto?
S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: Azuq, Qaal asa laqbingin suqaisun zakuan.
Azoq, Qaal asa laqbingin soqaison zakoan.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: Qudanan in, Uka nak Talulung dasun, Pasimuling aak Talulung?
Qodanan in, Uka nak Talolong dason, Pasimoling aak Talolong?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me one?

S.FORM: Musqa nak tas-a Talulung, Muskun ata talulungan!
Mosqa nak tas-a Talolong, Moskon ata talolongan!
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

S.FORM: Ma Haqil i isu tudip sinpasimul zaku, Suqaisun in zaku.
Ma Haqil i iso todip sinpasimol zako, Soqaison in zako.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: Na maaq su asaun muqna sadu Haqil maqtu amin taqu zaku.
Na maaq so asaon moqna sado Haqil maqto amin taqo zako.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.
When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: Azuq, Maqi haizin suu sui a tudip in tupa.
Azoq, Maqi haizin soo soi a todip in topa.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.
When are you going to pay me back?
I'll return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: Na laquaq aas masuqis inak Haqil.
Na laqoaq aas masoqis inak Haqil.
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?
我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: Ispapatas dii isia Taliban pasimul aipa suu?
Ispapatas dii isia Taliban pasimol aipa soo?
S.TRANSL: Did Taliban lend you this pen?
Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: Ispapatas dii su'u simul han Taliban ta.
Ispapatas dii so'o simol han Taliban ta.
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Taliban?
No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: Uka in Qasilah, Ipin simul han Sani ta Qasilah.
Uka in Qasilah, Ipin simol han Sani ta Qasilah.
S.TRANSL: We are out of salt, let's borrow some salt from Sani.

S.FORM: Tupa i Ibu a tu suqais i zakuan Sui.
Topa i Ibo a to soqais i zakoan Soi.
S.TRANSL: Go and ask Sani to return my money.

S.FORM: Piaq ista sinimulun su-uan Sui tu?
Piaq ista sinimolon so-oan Soi to?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: Na munhan aak patsanglavan masuaz sanglav.
Na monhan aak patsanglavan masoaz sanglav.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: Madia sa ka ismut, Ma valval aak, Unisin na masiul aak i danum.
Madia sa ka ismot, Ma valval aak, Unisin na masiol aak i danom.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There’s too much grass, I’m cutting it, I’ll have to water it later.

S.FORM: Dangaz i aak siza Kaul siin Tangaa azuq?
Dangaz i aak siza Kaol siin Tangaa azoq?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?

S.FORM: Laupang aak maisuqaz i dalaq, Unisin na minang.
Laopang aak maisoqaz i dalaq, Unisin na minang.
S.TRANSL: 我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: Sinuaz suu Sanaglav maqtu in sizaun?
Sinoaz soo Sanaglav maqto in sizaon?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: I-iti Tamana maqtu in sizaun, Idaiza Quduh nii'ang maqtu sizaun.
I-iti Tamana maqto in sizaon, Idaiza Qodoh nii'ang maqto sizaon.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的龍葵就還不能收成。
The cabbages here are ready to harvest, but the nightshade there is not yet ready.

S.FORM: Maa na! Madia suu sa singkai Hutan.
Maa na! Madia soo sa singkai Hotan.
S.TRANSL: 哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
Wow! You dug up so many gourds.
Will you help me with the barn?

S.FORM: Mapunda aam islalaqnut Iskaan Kalala na madamu Iskaan.
Maponda aam islalaqnot Iskaan Kalala na madamo Iskaan.
S.TRANSL: We’re releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

S.FORM: Iskaan kalala kumbu madia in sindamu Iskaan.
Iskaan kalala kombo madia in sindamo Iskaan.
S.TRANSL: 魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish traps have been full of fish, Iskaan kalala kumbu madia in sindamu Iskaan.

S.FORM: Qanglas aas piqauq suu madamu Iskaan?
Qanglas aas piqaoq soo madamo Iskaan?
S.TRANSL: How do you usually catch fish?

S.FORM: Kusia aak Iskaan islalaupa manaq Iskaan.
Kosia aak Iskaan islalaopa manaq Iskaan.
S.TRANSL: I shoot fish with a spear.
Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: Qanglas aak makusia Haqu madamu taklilibus, Mintun amin siza Busul madas Asu qanup.
Qanglas aak makosia Haqo madamo taklilibos, Minton amin siza Bosol madas Aso qanop.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: Isia aipi Vanis maidapan, Paqpun ma aipi a liniqaiban Vanis tu daan.
Isia aipi Vanis maidapan, Paqpon ma aipi a liniqaiban Vanis to daan.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: Kava mintivi imita Haqu, Haut udamu'an in?
Kava mintivi imita Haqo, Haot odamo'an in?
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: Maqa Asu a maszang usakan, Kava ata makilavih.
Maqa Aso a maszang osakan, Kava ata makilavih.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let’s follow them.
你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: Maaq aipi a batu haqu, Iskusia madamu Qamutis.
Maaq aipi a bato haqo, Iskosia madamo Qamotis.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.
你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: Maaq aipun a Bantas haqu, Makusia istun madamu Sakut.
Maaq aipon a Bantas haqo, Makosia iston madamo Sakot.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: Matumasqing maimadadaingaz sintuqumis. Haip tu qanian madia a tinishaquan.
Matomasqing maimadadaingaz sintoqomis. Haip to qanian madia a tinishaqoan.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: Tuza! Na adasun ita musuqis han Asang pisihalun mangunu maqusil!
Toza! Na adason ita mosoqis han Asang pisihalon mangono maqosil!
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let’s take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: Mahaip sinsi na masnava tuqau takilibus malas bunun tupa.
Mahaip sinsi na masnava toqao takilibos malas bonon topa.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的布農語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Bunun language today.

S.FORM: Mahaip sinsi na masnava tuqau qaupa ismut'lukis malas bunun tupa.
Mahaip sinsi na masnava toqao qaopa ismot'lokis malas bonon topa.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的布農語怎麼說。

S.FORM: Mahaip sinsi na masnava tuqau kaununkaunun malas bunun tupa.
Mahaip sinsi na masnava toqao kaononkaonon malas bonon topa.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的布農語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Bunun language today.

S.FORM: Nii, isia aipi Sani tu hulus.
Nii, isia aipi Sani to holos.

S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.
Share the book with your classmate next to you.
I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: Na mal'uin, aam, mananulu'ah ihaan muluma tu daan.
Na mal'oin, aam, mananolo'ah ihaan moloma to daan.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心!
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

S.FORM: Na mal'uin aam, pasaduh ata laq'bingin.
Na mal'oin aam, pasadoh ata laq'bingin.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，大家明天見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: Miqumisang, manak ngan tupaun tu Tiang.
Miqomisang, manak ngan topaon to Tiang.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Tiang.

S.FORM: Miqumisang, manak ngan tupaun tu Talum.
Miqomisang, manak ngan topaon to Talom.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Talum.

S.FORM: Isia ak Talum tu tina, Apin ak.
Isia ak Talom to tina, Apin ak.
Isia aak Buaq tu naubanau'az, tupaun naak ngan tu Uli.
Isia aak Boaq to naobanao'az, topaon naak ngan to Uli.
S.TRANSL: 我是Bauaq的妹妹，我的名字是Uli。
I am Bauaq’s sister. My name is Uli.

S.FORM: Inak aipun masnanava, tupaun aipun tu Lumav.
Inak aipon masnanava, topaon aipon to Lomav.
Inak aipun tu'qasbananaz, tupaun aipun tu Paki.
Inak aipon to'qasbananaz, topaon aipon to Paki.
Tuqau sia toqas nau'az su tun ngan?
Toqao sia toqas nao'az so ton ngan?
S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: Manak toqas nau'az tun tu ngan tupaun tu Lauva.
Manak toqas nao'az ton to ngan topaon to Laova.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister’s name is Lauva.

S.FORM: Tuqau sia nauba nau'az su tun ngan?
Toqao sia naoba nao'az so ton ngan?
S.TRANSL: What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: Manak nauba nau'az tun tu ngan tupaun tu Mua.
Manak naoba nao'az ton to ngan topaon to Moa.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister’s name is Mua.
How old is your elder brother?
How old is your younger brother?
Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: Ihan as asang tu kaku vingkiu?
Ihan as asang to kako vingkio?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: Uu, ihan kaku vingkiu maszang tuza tastu lumaq.
Uo, ihan kako vingkio maszang toza tasto lomaq.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.
你的媽媽從事什麼工作?
你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: Nii, isia aipun inak nauba nanaz tu kaviaz.
Nii, isia aipon inak naoba nanaz to kaviaz.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.
No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.

S.FORM: Piaq su nauba nanaz sin nauba nau'az?
Piaq so naoba nanaz sin naoba nao'az?
S.TRANSL: How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: Uka nak nauba nanaz, haiza nak tau tu nauba nau'az.
Uka nak naoba nanaz, haiza nak tao to naoba nao'az.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

S.FORM: Piaq su tuqas nanaz sin tuqas nau'az?
Piaq so toqas nanaz sin toqas nao'az?
S.TRANSL: How many older siblings do you have?

S.FORM: Uka nak tuqas nanaz sin tuqas nau'az.
Uka nak toqas nanaz sin toqas nao'az.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: Kama kazhav diqanin. Asa pidia'un quu baqais danum.
Kama kazhav diqanin. Asa pidia'on qoo baqais danom.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: Kama mabaqais diqani, asa pidia'un quu danum.
Kama mabaqais diqani, asa pidia'on qoo danom.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.
The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: Madia luhum. Uka han diqanin tun vali.
Madia lohom. Uka han diqanin ton vali.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: Uka laqbing vali, madia luhum, madaing luvluv.
Uka laqbing vali, madia lohom, madaing lovlov.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: Kama kazhav haip, munata tu asa painukan panhapavun hulus.
Kama kazhav haip, monata to asa painokan panhapavon holos.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: Masihal tudipin diqanin. Na nii tu qunanan.
Masihal todipin diqanin. Na nii to qonanan.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.
The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: Qudanan in. Nii ak madas i talulung.
Qodanan in. Nii ak madas i talolong.
S.TRANSL: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: Nii laupaku qudanan. na qunanan i tinungqu in, munata asa madas talulung.
Nii laopako qodanan. na qonanan i tinongqo in, monata asa madas talolong.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: Na makazhav i pungnin tu qamisan?
Na makazhav i pongnin to qamisan?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: Uu, pungnin tu qamisan na makazhav daingaz, asa pidi'un hulus mainuk.
Uo, pongnin to qamisan na makazhav daingaz, asa pidi'on holos mainok.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: Na mabaqis daingaz haip tu talaban?
Na mabaqis daingaz haip to talaban?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: Uu, mabaqis daingaz i talaban. Asa pi'diun danum quu.
Uo, mabaqis daingaz i talaban. Asa pi'dion danom qoo.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.
我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: Ni ak asa mimqamisan. Madia luvluvan ihan minqamisan.
Ni ak asa mimqamisan. Madia lovlovan ihan minqamisan.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.
I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?
Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: Tangusan as munita, munita ak unisin kilim suu.
Tangosan as monita, monita ak onisin kilim soo.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.
No, we have to carry books first.
Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.
Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: Na malka maaq aas pudanun in han kaku?
Na malka maaq aas podanon in han kako?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: Na maqamaq aipun i pudanun in han kaku?
Na maqamaq aipon i podanon in han kako?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: Uka Apin lumaq ti, ma'aq is bazbaz. taqua i musuqis sin Apin.
Uka Apin lomaq ti, ma'aq is bazbaz. taqoa i mosoqis sin Apin.
S.TRANSL: Apin不在家耶!有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告Apin。
Apin is not at home. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: Bai, Abus sin Apin aam, indangazavan aam matua hilav.
Bai, Abos sin Apin aam, indangazavan aam matoa hilav.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是Abas 和 Apin，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are Abas and Apin, please open the door for us.
I am vilian, I am here for Atul.
Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: Talmadin aas nii tu minsuma, minliskin ak su.
Talmadin aas nii to minsoma, minliskin ak so.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.
Apin, I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: Kava'a mungkumbu lumaq. Malibuntu in mantala suu.
Kava'a mongkombo lomaq. Malibonto in mantala soo.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: Inak aipi sinsuaz tu Hutan. Tanami maun.
Inak aipi sinsoaz to Hotan. Tanami maon.
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: Zain, inak aipi sinsuaz tu kaununkaunun, tanami maun.
Zain, inak aipi sinsoaz to kaononkaonon, tanami maon.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: Malungqua, inak aipi sinsuaz ni tu pundan iiu tu lamuqu, tanami maun.
Malongqoa, inak aipi sinsoaz ni to pondan iio to lamoqo, tanami maon.
S.TRANSL: 請坐! 這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.
Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: Ni ak maqtu maun izuk. Sia nak lingqu tun qaunun.
Ni ak maqto maon izok. Sia nak lingqo ton qaonon.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.
Let me peel the fruit for you.

S.FORM: Uningan, kaununkaunun i madia sa vus.
Uningan, kaononkaonon i madia sa vos.
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.
I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: Pidiav maun, madia nak sinhanat pandian.
Pidiav maon, madia nak sinhanat pandian.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: Uu! Tutuza tu mahansum daingaz masihal sa qaunun.
Uo! Totoza to mahansom daingaz masihal sa qaonon.
S.TRANSL: 嗚! 真的很香也好吃。
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.
Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.
Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: Madia in nak kaunun, niin ak maqtu maun.
Madia in nak kaonon, niin ak maqto maon.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: Ma'ah haip sinsi a na madas muu munhan ba'av.
Ma'ah haip sinsi a na madas moo monhan ba'av.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: Tupa tina tu madia ihan ba'av ta qatibin.
Topa tina to madia ihan ba'av ta qatibin.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: Ma'ah haip sinsi a na madas muu munhan qumah.
Ma'ah haip sinsi a na madas moo monhan qomah.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?
Teacher will take us to the riverside.
Teacher will take us to the mountains today.
Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: Nii, dasun ata sinsi munhan ba'av.
Nii, dason ata sinsi monhan ba'av.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?
不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: Sinsi, maq mita saduan ihan vanglaz ta tu?
Sinsi, maq mita sadoan ihan vanglaz ta to?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: Sinsi, na ma'aq mita ihan ba'av ta saduan tu?
Sinsi, na ma'aq mita ihan ba'av ta sadoan to?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: Munhan ata qumah sadu imita sinsuaz tu lamuqu, asa mananulu i na haiza qalua sin baqusaz.
Monhan ata qomah sado imita sinsoaz to lamoqo, asa mananolo i na haiza qaloa sin baqosaz.
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: Sinsi, na munhan ata vanglaz lingqaul?
Sinsi, na monhan ata vanglaz lingqaol?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: Nii, mun ita ata sadu talingkukas.
Nii, mon ita ata sado talingkokas.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: Sinsi, na munhan ata qumah masuaz sanglav?
Sinsi, na monhan ata qomah masoaz sanglav?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: Laupan sak haip saduu miqumis tu talingkukas.
Laopan sak haip sadoo miqomis to talingkokas.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: Baii, asa ak sa talikuan, manau'az saa.
Baii, asa ak sa talikoan, manao'az saa.
S.TRANSL: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.
Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: Idi a sadu, katu mun han daqvisan tu dangianan.
Idi a sado, kato mon han daqvisan to dangianan.
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: Uu, ni am mun han daqvisan tu dangianan.
Uo, ni am mon han daqvisan to dangianan.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: Katu tindankul, madaukdauk ka mudandan diaqnaip na mutinkul.
Kato tindankol, madaokdaok ka modandan diaqnaip na motinkol.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?
How does he go to the hospital?
How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by plane.
How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: Tun daza ak qatu munhan Puunhu.
Ton daza ak qato monhan Poonho.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: Tun ma'aq Abus sun munhan kaku?
Ton ma'aq Abos son monhan kako?
S.TRANSL: How does Abus go to school?

S.FORM: Tun daza Abus sun laihlaihsapuz munhan kaku.
Ton daza Abos son laihlaihsapoz monhan kako.
S.TRANSL: Abus goes to school by train.
How does Talum go to church?
Talum goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: Tun daza as mahaipi munhan kaku?
Ton daza as mahaipi monhan kako?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: Nii, tun daza ak vasu munhan kaku.
Nii, ton daza ak vaso monhan kako.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: Uu, tun tauntaun ak munhan kaku.
Uo, ton taontaon ak monhan kako.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: Tun daza as haiiai tu laihlaih sapuz munhan takauu?
Ton daza as haiiai to laihlaih sapoz monhan takaoo?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: Uu, tun daza ak haiiai tu laihlaih sapuz munhan takau.
Uo, ton daza ak haiiai to laihlaih sapoz monhan takao.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: Tun daza naupa as laihlaih sapuz i hikuki munhan taitu?
Ton daza naopa as laihlaih sapoz i hikoki monhan taito?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: Tun daza ak hikuki, tun daza hikuki mastan haiiai i laihlaih sapuz.
Ton daza ak hikoki, ton daza hikoki mastan haiiai i laihlaih sapoz.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: Munhan kiukai a tun daza naupa as vasu a anak naupa untin?
Monhan kiokai a ton daza naopa as vaso a anak naopa ontin?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: Anak ak untin munhan kiukai. Anak untin a mastan tun daza vasu masihal.
Anak ak ontin monhan kiokai. Anak ontin a mastan ton daza vaso masihal.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: Mishuan su lumaq kamadaing tu babalivan?
Mishoan so lomaq kamadaing to babalivan?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: Daqvisan nan. Tun utuvai ak munhan kamadaing tu babalivan.
Daqvisan nan. Ton otovai ak monhan kamadaing to babalivan.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.
Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.
Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: Minahan papaluan tananak hima pungkan na maqtu taudadip.
Minahan papaloan tananak hima pongkan na maqto taodadip.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: Uka ak haip han lumaq, kilim dumah tu qani'anan.
Uka ak haip han lomaq, kilim domah to qani'anan.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家，改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: Haiza suu laqbingin ail'uan? Mum su'uan ak tinunqu in kilim suu.
Haiza soo laqbingin ail'oan? Mom so'oan ak tinonqo in kilim soo.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: Azuq'naip, ihan ak lumaq mantala suu.
Azoq'naip, ihan ak lomaq mantala soo.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: Maqtu ak siza qalinga? Asa ak kiluku.
Maqto ak siza qalinga? Asa ak kiloko.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: Nii ak masihal saduan. Nii amin na pa'tilasan sankunun, azuq nii.
Nii ak masihal sadoan. Nii amin na pa'tilasan sankonon, azoq nii.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.
Thank you for accepting the interview.
You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: Asa bazbaz su'uan tu maqamaq as qabas mainduduaz an?
Asa bazbaz so'oan to maqamaq as qabas maindodoaz an?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?
我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: Takihan suu amin uvaz'az zun asang?
Takihan soo amin ovaz'az zon asang?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?
不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: Saipuk ak tas'a asu sin tas'a luqei, inak ainkun amin tastu lumaq.
Saipok ak tas'a aso sin tas'a loqei, inak ainkon amin tasto lomaq.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: Saipuk ak amin tas'a ngaun, maqai haiza saipukun a na nii tu hanimulmul.
Saipok ak amin tas'a ngaon, maqai haiza saipokon a na nii to hanimolmol.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: Asa ak mapasnava suu paliuni qanup tu samuh.
Asa ak mapasnava soo palioni qanop to samoh.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: Ni nak madia qansaipun, maqai naipuk a taqua tupa aas.
Ni nak madia qansaipon, maqai naipok a taqoa topa aas.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: Amu qanup tu qaimansut haiza naupa samu?
Amo qanop to qaimansot haiza naopa samo?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: I nam qanup tu qaimansut ni tu maqtu patiduan binanau'az.
I nam qanop to qaimansot ni to maqto patidoan binanao'az.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.
那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: Nitu maqtu, nii amin binanau'az maqtu qanup.
Nito maqto, nii amin binanao'az maqto qanop.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Atul, ukin lumaq davus, ipin as ma daliv davus.
Atol, okin lomaq davos, ipin as ma daliv davos.
S.TRANSL: Atul，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Atul, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: Haizan tutuvangan ta tas'a paan, nin ma daliv au?
Haizan totovangan ta tas'a paan, nin ma daliv ao?
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧？
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: Mavai tas'a paan, ipin muqnang ma daliv dusa paan.
Mavai tas'a paan, ipin moqnang ma daliv dosa paan.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: Ma daliv ak davus, haiza muu?
Ma daliv ak davos, haiza moo?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: Daliv ak dusa paan, na ma daliv van ak tas'a tilas.
Daliv ak dosa paan, na ma daliv van ak tas'a tilas.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: I han di tilas, haizan suu na asa un?
I han di tilas, haizan soo na asa on?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: Na ma daliv an ak nibuh, haiza muu?
Na ma daliv an ak niboh, haiza moo?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?
I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: Ma daliv ak putuq imah tu hulus.
Ma daliv ak potoq imah to holos.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.
We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: Aivin ak tas'a madiav tu hulus.
Aivin ak tas'a madiav to holos.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Talum, mun isaq as sangan? Tindangul as?
Talom, mon isaq as sangan? Tindangol as?
S.TRANSL: Talum你剛剛去哪裡了?你去跑步嗎?
Talum, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: Nii, mim dangaz ak bai nak ma daliv sanglav.
Nii, mim dangaz ak bai nak ma daliv sanglav.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: Maupata qan, haiza suu sanavan ail'uan? Na muskun naupa as zaku ma'un qaising?
Maopata qan, haiza soo sanavan ail'oan? Na moskon naopa as zako ma'on qaising?
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯?
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: Nii maqtu, na ma daliv ak hulus.
Nii maqto, na ma daliv ak holos.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: Miqumisang, piaq di sinluqus tu sanglav vun sui?
Miqomisang, piaq di sinloqos to sanglav von soi?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: Sanglav tas'a sinluqus mapusan tu sui.
Sanglav tas'a sinloqos maposan to soi.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?
Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: Aivin ak dusa sinluqus sanglav sin tas'a tingting tu hutan.
Aivin ak dosa sinloqos sanglav sin tas'a tingting to hotan.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Laung, sipungul ak madas ispapatas, maqtu as pasimul zaku?
Laong, sipongol ak madas ispapatas, maqto as pasimol zako?
S.TRANSL: Laung，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Laung, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: Uka nak amin, isia aipi Abus.
Uka nak amin, isia aipi Abos.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is Abus’s.

S.FORM: Duuq i maqtu naupa muhiav pasimul zaku? Hai'iai aak masuqai suu.
Dooq i maqto naopa mohiav pasimol zako? Hai'iai aak masoqai soo.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: Uningan, mindangaz amin zaku matumasqain i Abus.
Uningan, mindangaz amin zako matomasqain i Abos.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Abus for me.
I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: Asang aak simul i tau tu haqil
Asang aak simol i tao to haqil
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: Uu, katu sipungul suqaisav i taltiun in.
Uo, kato sipongol soqaisav i taltion in.
S.TRANSL: 好了。記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: Nii an as masuqis zaku isqaqaisqais.
Nii an as masoqis zako isqaqaisqais.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: Mavia inak tu isqaqaisqais is uka saduan.
Mavia inak to isqaqaisqais is oka sadoan.
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?
Did you lend it to Talum?

S.FORM: Nii ak niap, un ita uk tupa i.
Nii ak niap, on ita ok topa i.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: Tangus ak pasimul su inak tu isqaqaisqais.
Tangos ak pasimol so inak to isqaqaisqais.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Sani, sia Vilian pasimul suu malhapavun tu hulus i?
Sani, sia Vilian pasimol soo malhapavon to holos i?
S.TRANSL: Sani, did Vilian lend you this coat?

S.FORM: Nii, isia aipi inaak tina sinbaliv pai'naak
Nii, isia aipi inaak tina sinbaliv pai'naak
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: Lumav tu malhapavun tu hulus masdang tuza isu.
Lomav to malhapavon to holos masdang toza iso.
S.TRANSL: Lumav’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: Mataqdung istaa palhapavun tu hulus, nii naam maszang a patas.
Mataqdong istaa palhapavon to holos, nii naam maszang a patas.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Abus, simul as sui ihan Vilian ta?
Abos, simol as soi ihan Vilian ta?
S.TRANSL: Abus, did you borrow money from Vilian?

S.FORM: Haiza, na suqaisuk nau haip a, sipungul ak madas sui.
Haiza, na soqaisok nao haip a, sipongol ak madas soi.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: Uu, in dangaz uk as taqu Vilian.
Uo, in dangaz ok as taqo Vilian.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Vilian for you.

S.FORM: Asa ka qamutis tu kusian mal'qatu madamu. Asa ka tikulas tu kusian mal'haqu musqut madamu. Maupata nanu isdadamu.
Asa ka qamotis to kosian mal'qato madamo. Asa ka tikolas to kosian mal'haqo mosqot madamo. Maopata nano isdadamo.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: Maupata qan, minlaliva in ak, panqan ni ak udamuan.
Maopata qan, minlaliva in ak, panqan ni ak odamoan.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: Muqnan ak masnava su piqau matasi malqatu sin malhaqu musqut tu haqu.
Moqnan ak masnava so piqao matasi malqato sin malhaqo mosqot to haqo.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作石壓式及套頸式這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to make two traps, the stone pressure trap and the neck trap.

S.FORM: Azuqnaip, mastan tu masihal! Na maqtuin ak qabasin udamuan taklilibus.
Azoqnaip, mastan to masihal! Na maqtoin ak qabasin odamoan taklilibos.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: Mada'vasin a quma tu ismut, ipin as munhan patilasan ta siza qaul, munhan ata qumah.
Mada'vasin a qoma to ismot, ipin as monhan patilasan ta siza qaol, monhan ata qomah.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: Antan ngalan i tangaa, usaduan as i munkunbu in patilasan.
Antan ngalan i tangaa, osadoan as i monkonbo in patilasan.
S.TRANSL: 在鋤頭的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: Mananulua siza, ka'a tu milu'lu, manusqait a kaul.
Mananoloa siza, ka'a to milo'lo, manosqait a kaol.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: Ka'a tu kandapan inak tu ha'quh!
Ka'a to kandapan inak to ha'qoh!
Antan han nak haqu lukis haul ta.
Antan han nak haqo lokis haol ta.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: Haiza nak iti sin pasaqal, maqansiap ak tu isaq nak haqu.
Haiza nak iti sin pasaqal, maqansiap ak to isaq nak haqo.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: Iskan haqu aipi, hanun zami sisilah vanlaz malhaqu iskan.
Iskan haqo aipi, hanon zami sisilah vanlaz malhaqo iskan.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: Uka zamian ta iskanhaqu'kalala, makusia aam islalaskan madamu ki iskaan.
Uka zamian ta iskanhaqo'kalala, makosia aam islalaskan madamo ki iskaan.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: Nii'ang ak maikusia islalaskan malaskan iskan, maqtu as muqnin masnava zaku?
Nii'ang ak maikosia islalaskan malaskan iskan, maqto as moqnin masnava zako?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?
好啊，我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: Na isnava'ak as muqnin matas'i iskan haquh.
Na isnava'ak as moqnin matas'i iskan haqoh.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: Bisukbisuk kin isu islalaskan nun, haizing naupa iskan tis haqu, kavai sibutbut.
Bisokbisok kin iso islalaskan non, haizing naopa iskan tis haqo, kavai sibotbot.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: Mal'uang, masmuavin a qatu viduqviduq saa, ihaan aak dii mabutbut i islalaskan, ipin aas munhaan daiza mindangaz zaku siza i tavukul.
Mal'oang, masmoavin a qato vidoqvidoq saa, ihaan aak dii mabotbot i islalaskan, ipin aas monhaan daiza mindangaz zako siza i tavokol.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: Sibutbut i su iskan punipa zakuan ti, indangazuk ass sibutbut.
Sibotbot i so iskan ponipa zakoan ti, indangazok ass sibotbot.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: Manaskal daingaz, madia haip sin damuh, lamakmuzan in iskan tu kalala.
Manaskal daingaz, madia haip sin damoh, lamakmozan in iskan to kalala.
S.TRANSL: 太高興了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: Kava ata musuqis paqusil kaupaka taisian.
Kava ata mosoqis paqosil kaopaka taisian.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.
不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: Asihima haip, namal'uu'in laqbing, muskun ata munata qaitmal!
Asihima haip, namal'oo'in laqbing, moskon ata monata qaitmal!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: Uu i! munhaan ata sisila vanglaz qaitmal.
Uo i! monhaan ata sisila vanglaz qaitmal.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: Asitau laqbingin, pismali ata laqbing minaunin!
Asitao laqbingin, pismali ata laqbing minaonin!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: Islunquan laqbingin, namuskun aak tina naak munhaan kiukai lihai.
Islonqoan laqbingin, namoskon aak tina naak monhaan kiokai lihai.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.
I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: Sinsi! masaqbit naak a tian, asa aak munata.
Sinsi! masaqbit naak a tian, asa aak monata.
S.TRANSL: 老師!我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: Sinsi! masaqbit daingaz naak a bungu, namasingav aak minaunin.
Sinsi! masaqbit daingaz naak a bongo, namasingav aak minaonin.
S.TRANSL: 老師!我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: Sinsi! Namasingav aak muqnin tu asitas'a, Aupa namunhaan aak ising.
Sinsi! Namasingav aak moqnin to asitas'a, Aopa namonhaan aak ising.
S.TRANSL: 老師!我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: Masaqbit istaa tian, ihaan aipa unanata'an.
Masaqbit istaa tian, ihaan aipa onanata'an.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: Sinsi! Masaqbit Pima ta qaungqaung, masingav aipa haip qanian.
Sinsi! Masaqbit Pima ta qaongqaong, masingav aipa haip qanian.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Pima has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: Mavia ka Aquz tu uka minsuma i?
Mavia ka Aqoz to oka minsoma i?
Maaq aak a Vatan tanapima, taingka mangdavan.
Maaq aak a Vatan tanapima, taingka mangdavan.
S.TRANSL: My name is Vatan Tanapima, and my mom is Mrs.Doo.
What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: Maaq aak a itu Bunun tu uvavaz'az.
Maaq aak a ito Bonon to ovavaz'az.

S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: Uu, Bunun tuza amin aam tastulumaq.
Uo, Bonon toza amin aam tastolomaq.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是布農族人。
Yes, my whole family is Bunun.
你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: Nii, Bunun naak tama, Tauluu naak tina.
Nii, Bonon naak tama, Taoloo naak tina.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是布農族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Bunun, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: Maaq naak tama ka tupaun tu Vatan, tupaun naak tina tu Ali.
Maaq naak tama ka topaon to Vatan, topaon naak tina to Ali.
S.TRANSL: My father is Vatan, my mother is Ali.

S.FORM: Isuu aipa tama? piaqin istaa qamisan?
Isoo aipa tama? piaqin istaa qamisan?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: Isuu aipa tama? Piaqin istaa ka qamisan?
Isoo aipa tama? Piaqin istaa ka qamisan?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: Nii, nii aipa inaak tama, inaam asang tu madadaingaz, mavaunin istaa ka qamisan.
Nii, nii aipa inaak tama, inaam asang to madadaingaz, mavaonin istaa ka qamisan.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: Piaqin suu tuqas nanaz ta ka qamisan?
Piaqin soo toqas nanaz ta ka qamisan?
Mas'an qan vau'in qamisan naak a tuqas nanaza.
Mas'an qan vao'in qamisan naak a toqas nanaza.
Madaing suu tuqas nanaz ta sinpaqais suu tu qamisan?
Madaing soo toqas nanaz ta sinpaqais soo to qamisan?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: Tas'a saba tu masipatun inaak a kaidaqvasan.
Tas'a saba to masipaton inaak a kaidaqvasan.
Talmadiin nitu pasaduu, duuq i taldaqvasin aas?
Talmadiin nito pasadoo, dooq i taldaqvasin aas?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: Uu i! Taldaqvasin aak. Tastu saba'in tu matiun naak a kaidaqvasan.
Uo i! Taldaqvasin aak. Tasto saba'in to mation naak a kaidaqvasan.
Namunhaan aak sinsi tu kuzkuza'an kilim i sinsi.
Namonhaan aak sinsi to kozkoza'an kilim i sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: Ihaan aipa linqaqaulan, naminhamu aipa unisin paintataiv.
Ihaan aipa linqaqaolan, naminhamo aipa onisin paintataiv.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: Isaq a Ibua? napaintataiv aipa unisin linqaul.
Isaq a Iboa? napaintataiv aipa onisin linqaol.
S.TRANSL: Ibua在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Ibua? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: Ihaan aipa u'anpukan ta, na'una'uuk aipa.
Ihaan aipa o'anpokan ta, na'ona'ook aipa.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: Ngausang aak mabaliv muqus, nakilimuk aas unisin.
Ngaosang aak mabaliv moqos, nakilimok aas onisin.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.
Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: Kilima duma bunun mindangaz suu! Nakilim aak sinsi.
Kilima doma bonon mindangaz soo! Nakilim aak sinsi.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人幫助妳!我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: Naminhamu ka Umasa haip paintataiv i matungtung mali?
Naminhamo ka Umasa haip paintataiv i matongtong mali?
S.TRANSL: Is Umas competing in croquet today?
No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: Naminhaamu aas paintataiv ihaan unzukai tu qani'anan?
Naminhaamo aas paintataiv ihaan onzokai to qani'anan?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: Naminhamu aas paintataiv ihaan unzukai tu qani'anan?
Naminhamo aas paintataiv ihaan onzokai to qani'anan?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: Nama'aq mita palkada'an ihaan unzukai tu qani'anan?
Nama'aq mita palkada'an ihaan onzokai to qani'anan?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: Namabaliv ata kakaunun ihaan unzukai tu qani'anan?
Namabaliv ata kakaonon ihaan onzokai to qani'anan?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: Tuza aas tu kapanuun, kitnganagus suu ka kaitaliskangan tidankul!
Toza aas to kapanoon, kitnganagos soo ka kaitaliskangan tidankol!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了跑步第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!
Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: Uka, laupang aipa munata, nasanavanin aipa mulumaq.
Uka, laopang aipa monata, nasanavanin aipa molomaq.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: Ihaan aipa dadaza ta, munhana dadaza ta kilim istaa!
Ihaan aipa dadaza ta, monhana dadaza ta kilim istaa!
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: Laung qana! Talmadia'in aak nii saduu suu. Masihal aas?
Laong qana! Talmadia'in aak nii sadoo soo. Masihal aas?
S.TRANSL: 是Laung阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Laung. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: Masihal i! Munsu'uan aak haip pababazbaz suu.
Masihal i! Monso'oan aak haip pababazbaz soo.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: Ihaan aipa pipit'aian mahanat sanglav, naluklasak aipa.
Ihaan aipa pipit'aian mahanat sanglav, naloklasak aipa.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: Munhaan aipa patulkukan madamu ki tulkuk.
Monhaan aipa patolkokan madamo ki tolkok.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: Munhaan muu akia quma kuzakuza, uka ilumaq, ihaana amu lumaq ta maltatala istaa mulumaq.
Monhaan moo akia qoma kozakoza, oka ilomaq, ihaana amo lomaq ta maltatala istaa molomaq.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.
I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.
It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: Maaq a bunglai una ispaska muu, pihanav piskakazhav kunbu madainpus.
Maaq a bonglai ona ispaska moo, pihanav piskakazhav konbo madainpos.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: Talmadia'in nitu patantutungu, na'anpukuk amu muskun maun i qaising.
Talmadia'in nito patantotongo, na'anpokok amo moskon maon i qaising.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒有互訪，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: Azuq nii, munhaan ata lumaq ta, quud ki ucia pababazbaz.
Azoq nii, monhaan ata lomaq ta, qood ki ocia pababazbaz.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我們喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: Uninang imuu sinkasaulvaz zakuan, namudanin aak.
Uninang imoo sinkasaolvaz zakoan, namodanin aak.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: Laupang a tulkuk un pinataz, dasav mapulumaq mapit'ia.
Laopang a tolkok on pinataz, dasav mapolomaq mapit'ia.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去煮。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: Duuq i maqtu ata ihaan laqbing tu minaunin mapasaduu?
Dooq i maqto ata ihaan laqbing to minaonin mapasadoo?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: Maqtu ihaan kaku' ta? Nalu'in ata
Maqto ihaan kako' ta? Nalo'in ata
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: Azuq munhaan u'anpukan ta, namainuk aak hulus Bunun.
Azoq monhaan o'anpokan ta, namainok aak holos Bonon.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: Manau'az naam asang ti ka dandan, maaq i kapupuaqin a munzakuana tantungu!
Manao'az naam asang ti ka dandan, maaq i kapopoaqin a monzakoana tantongo!
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: Na'asang tu sauhaan mintalaban maltatala suu, natalmadia'ang tu!
Na'asang to saohaan mintalaban maltatala soo, natalmadia'ang to!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?
那你聖誕節的時候來吧!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: Mavia aas tu namudaan mulumaq i?
Mavia aas to namodaan molomaq i?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回家裡呢?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: Mavia nitu ihaan asang-daingaz ti min'uni masnanava i?
Mavia nito ihaan asang-daingaz ti min'oni masnanava i?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: Aupa masalpu aak inaak asang, asa masaunbaas i asang tu sinkadaidaz zakuan.
Aopa masalpo aak inaak asang, asa masaonbaas i asang to sinkadaidaz zakoan.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: Maqansiap aas matindun, simaq maisnava suu tu?
Maqansiap aas matindon, simaq maisnava soo to?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: Sia inaak bai maisnava zaku, mastaan aipa tu maqansiap matindun ihaan asang naam ti.
Sia inaak bai maisnava zako, mastaan aipa to maqansiap matindon ihaan asang naam ti.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: Mavia aas tu asa mapasnava matindun hulus i?
Mavia aas to asa mapasnava matindon holos i?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: Maaq a matindun hulus una inaam tu vungka', asauk aipi mapalmamaupa.
Maaq a matindon holos ona inaam to vongka', asaok aipi mapalmamaopa.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: Maaq aipi a inaak sinkai'uni tu davus.
Maaq aipi a inaak sinkai'oni to davos.
Tutuza aas tu masaihuu, talmadia aas kadavus ti?
Totoza aas to masaihoo, talmadia aas kadavos ti?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: Nitu talmadia, musqa taltiun. ngausun a dulaz masasngul, a pitdazaunin, susan i tamul haan pakiung a, a mindavusin.
Nito talmadia, mosqa taltion. ngaoson a dolaz masasngol, a pitdazaonin, sosan i tamol haan pakiong a, a mindavosin.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約三天就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about three days. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: Mababaliv aak dapuut siin salu-buqul, inaak amin tu sinsusuaz.
Mababaliv aak dapoot siin salo-boqol, inaak amin to sinsosoaz.
S.TRANSL: 我賣辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: Balivuk amin dusa un. Piaq sui-daing?
Balivok amin dosa on. Piaq soi-daing?
Muskun a dusa saba tu mahimaun sui-daing.
Moskon a dosa saba to mahimaon soi-daing.
Mazima aak hulus dii kun, piaq sui-daing?
Mazima aak holos dii kon, piaq soi-daing?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: Maaq aipun a hima saba suidaing.
Maaq aipon a hima saba soidaing.

S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: Nitu maqtu vanaqan, na nii aak mukalu.
Nito maqto vanaqan, na nii aak mokalo.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: Azuq i! Sia naak mataqdung hulus balivun.
Azoq i! Sia naak mataqdong holos balivon.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: Mabaliv aak via tun siin ngul'a tun.
Mabaliv aak via ton siin ngol'a ton.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: Muskun mapusan saba sui-daing, kain'anakan zaku matas'i, maqtu talmadia ikma'aiun.
Moskon maposan saba soi-daing, kain'anakan zako matas'i, maqto talmadia ikma'aion.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: Nataqu'ak kaviaz naak mun'itia mabaliv, Maqtu'ang vanaqan tu tikis?
Nataqo'ak kaviaz naak mon'itia mabaliv, Maqto'ang vanaqan to tikis?
S.TRANSL: 我要叫朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: Azuq i! Navanaqan zaku paat saba sui-daing.
Azoq i! Navanaqan zako paat saba soi-daing.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’ll give you a discount of 400 yuan.

S.FORM: Mun'itia mabaliv! haiza amin hulus siin tamuhung isbabaliv.
Mon'itia mabaliv! haiza amin holos siin tamohong isbabaliv.
S.TRANSL: 來這裡買喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: Tas'a hulus tau saba tu mahimaun sui-daing, tau hulus a mas'an saba sui-daing.
Tas'a holos tao saba to mahimaon soi-daing, tao holos a mas'an saba soi-daing.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: Mabaliv aak tas'a hulus, isizaav aak baqlu tu hulus.
Mabaliv aak tas'a holos, isizaav aak baqlo to holos.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: Uninang! Asa aak mabaliv hakhak siin tinapha titi.
Uninang! Asa aak mabaliv hakhak siin tinapha titi.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和燻過的肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and smoked meat.

S.FORM: Ukain a hakhak. haizang a inaliv, mabaliv aas?
Ukain a hakhak. haizang a inaliv, mabaliv aas?
S.TRANSL: 糯米飯賣完了。我還有年糕，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have rice cake, would you like to buy some?

S.FORM: Azuq i! Mabaliv aak tas'aun, namuqnang aak mun'iti mabaliv.
Azoq i! Mabaliv aak tas'aon, namoqnang aak mon'iti mabaliv.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: Uninang! nabutiqu'uk, haiza tu mahimaun sui-daing.
Uninang! nabotiqo'ok, haiza to mahimaon soi-daing.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
